label: 仕丁
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: corvee laborers from the provinces that served in the capital-at the palace and in households of high ranking officials-for three-year periods. According to the codes, for every 50 ko two laborers were to serve as shichō. Because of a high incidence of escape by such laborers, employment of day laborers paid with coin increased in the later Nara period, gradually replacing corvee workers. [戸]
